alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 06 at 10:50AM EST until March 06 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Wind gusts along peaks and ridges may gust in excess of 60 mph. * WHERE...In Maine, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin, and Northern Oxford Counties. In New Hampshire, Northern Coos County. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Open fields or lakes may experience brief periods of poor visibility in blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Recreation areas including ski areas across the mountains should be prepared for strong to potentially damaging wind gusts through the day. Higher wind gusts are also possible in the notches and passes.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
